decks.notes: This UrzaTron control deck focuses on assembling the Urza lands (Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate massive amounts of mana, allowing for the powerful late-game plays. The deck includes various Eldrazi threats to control the board, alongside removal spells like Dismember and All Is Dust. Karn, the Great Creator acts as a versatile toolbox while Ugin, the Spirit Dragon provides powerful board control. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with counterspells and removal, while setting up for a game-winning play with its powerful threats and high mana potential.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Overlord of the Balemurk. It aims to control the board with flicker effects from cards like Solitude and Flickerwisp, allowing for versatile and strategic gameplay. The deck also includes a toolbox of spells like Ephemerate and Teferi, Time Raveler to outmaneuver the opponent and gain incremental advantages. Overall, the deck combines aggression and disruption to wear down the opponent and secure victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to deal quick and efficient damage to the opponent. With support from cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Galvanic Discharge, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early on and maintain pressure throughout the game. The inclusion of cards like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison helps to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, this deck aims to win quickly through aggressive plays and efficient creature combat.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while generating advantage through card advantage and removal spells. By utilizing counterspells, hand disruption, and removal spells like Fatal Push, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and protect its win conditions. The inclusion of powerful threats like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, coupled with card advantage engines like Psychic Frog, allows the deck to outvalue its opponents and secure a victory through attrition. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's strategy and ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures and controlling the board with spells like Lightning Bolt and Leyline Binding. Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Scion of Draco provide powerful finishers, while Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu apply consistent pressure. Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Stubborn Denial offer additional disruption against opponents. The mana base is optimized for efficiency and consistency, allowing the deck to play both aggressively and defensively as needed. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of speed, power, and disruption.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on flooding the board with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, supported by burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. It aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a mixture of creature damage and direct burn damage, while also providing synergy with cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory. The deck also includes some control elements with cards like Static Prison and Thraben Charm to disrupt the opponent's game plan while continuing to apply pressure.

This deck aims to aggressively control the board by combining powerful creatures with disruptive spells. By using cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while playing aggressive creatures like Emperor of Bones and Overlord of the Balemurk, the deck can quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also utilizes cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to generate additional value from its creatures. Overall, the deck seeks to both pressure the opponent's life total and disrupt their game plan in order to secure victory.

This UW Control deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to gain advantage over the opponent. The deck also includes powerful board wipes like Supreme Verdict and Wrath of the Skies to clear the board. With the addition of the companion Kaheera, the Orphanguard, the deck gains consistency and a powerful late-game threat. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to control the game, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and win through incremental advantage.

This deck aims to control the game using a combination of powerful Eldrazi creatures and ramp spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Ugin, Eye of the Storms and Emrakul, the Promised End, the deck is able to both control the board and put immense pressure on the opponent. With a focus on mana acceleration through cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple, the deck is able to consistently cast its high-cost creatures and spells while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Kozilek's Command and Thought-Knot Seer.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively pressure the opponent with low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, backed up by burn spells such as Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart. The deck aims to maintain a strong aggressive presence while also disrupting the opponent with cards like Expressive Iteration and Slickshot Show-Off. Additionally, Violent Urge can provide a boost in power when needed, while cards like Mishra's Bauble and Preordain help to ensure consistent draws and keep the pressure on the opponent.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Mine, and Power Plant) to ramp into powerful Eldrazi creatures and planeswalkers. By controlling the board with removal spells like Dismember and All Is Dust, and disrupting the opponent's hand with Thought-Knot Seer and Glaring Fleshraker, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with high-powered threats like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Karn, the Great Creator. The deck's versatility and resilience make it a formidable control archetype in the Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent by playing creatures that have control effects and removal spells while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures. The goal is to slow down the opponent's game plan while steadily advancing your own board presence. By combining efficient removal spells with creatures that have disruptive abilities, this deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind out a victory through attrition. The deck also includes cards that provide card advantage and ways to protect your own threats, creating a well-rounded aggro-control strategy.

This deck focuses on using Allosaurus Rider with Eldritch Evolution and Neoform to quickly tutor for powerful creatures such as Griselbrand and Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant. The deck also includes cards like Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer for protection and disruption. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces as fast as possible to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and game-ending plays. Using mana dorks like Disciple of Freyalise and Generous Ent, the deck aims to ramp up quickly and execute its game plan efficiently.

The deck focuses on using disruptive counter spells and controlling spells to protect key combo pieces like Goblin Charbelcher and Lotus Bloom. It aims to quickly assemble a combo using cards like Whir of Invention and Thundertrap Trainer to win the game without relying on traditional lands. By utilizing cards like Jwari Disruption and Suppression Ray, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Fallaji Archaeologist provide card advantage and digging power to find the necessary combo pieces.

The main idea of this Aggro-Affinity deck is to quickly swarm the board with artifact creatures and utilize cards like Mishra's Bauble and Thoughtcast to draw additional cards, gaining advantage over the opponent. The deck also focuses on disruption through cards like Metallic Rebuke and Galvanic Blast. Emry, Lurker of the Loch provides recursion for artifacts in the graveyard, while cards like Mox Opal and Mox Amber help accelerate the deck's mana base. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient plays and a strong artifact synergy.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to quickly pressure opponents and deal damage. Support cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Goblin Bombardment provide additional damage and removal options. The deck also includes versatile spells like Thraben Charm and Ranger-Captain of Eos for added utility. The goal of this deck is to overwhelm opponents with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells, while also having access to a strong card draw engine with cards like Seasoned Pyromancer.
